# Top Navigation

**Tag:** `cui-top-nav`  
**Category:** components  
**Source:** https://coherence-ftekb0dcfpcjb3gv.b02.azurefd.net/resources/top-nav/

## Import

```js
import '@charm-ux/cui/dist/components/top-nav/index.js'
```


> Top navigation

## Guidance

### Top nav items (required)

- The active menu item in each nav indicates the page the reader is currently on. It is represented with a pressed state.

### Top nav menu (optional)

- Top navs can include dropdown menu items that nest subcategories.

### For narrower screens, the top nav condenses into a hamburger menu

- In smaller view ports like mobile size, this top nav menu expands to show subcategories in a navigation menu along with a back button showing parent category name.

### Separate top nav from pivots

- When using pivots with top nav, separate the components with another element so the reader recognizes the menu is global while the pivots pertain to that specific page.

### Use caution when placing breadcrumb and top nav together

- If breadcrumbs are necessary in the productâ€™s experience, use a side nav instead of a top nav as your app can get complex and confusing to navigate.

### Provide feedback

- Reach out to us if you spot a bug or have a feature request. Your feedback is critical to the success of Coherence and everyone who uses it.
